headerAuthorizationAppSecret.name: x-app-authorization
headerAuthorizationAppSecret.description: The `secretKey` or `testSecretKey` of the authenticating app.

headerAuthorizationAppSecretOptional.name: x-app-authorization
headerAuthorizationAppSecretOptional.description: The `secretKey` or `testSecretKey` of the authenticating app.

headerAuthorizationNonce.name: x-nonce
headerAuthorizationNonce.description: The nonce of the authenticating user.

headerAuthorizationNonceSignature.name: x-nonce-signature
headerAuthorizationNonceSignature.description: The nonce signature of the authenticating user.

queryAccessTokenExpiresAt.name: accessTokenExpiresAt
queryAccessTokenExpiresAt.description: An optional unix timestamp in seconds specifying when the returned `accessToken` should expire. If this value is provided, all prior `accessToken` will be invalidated and a new `accessToken` will be issued in the response. If no value is provided, the returned `accessToken` will not expire unless it is invalidated.

queryAs.name: as
queryAs.description: An address or walletId to perform as.

queryFunc.name: func
queryFunc.description: A function name or function signature.

queryTemplateApproved.name: approved
queryTemplateApproved.description: Set this query parameter to `true` to filter for approved templates.

queryTemplateName.name: name
queryTemplateName.description: A template name to partially or exactly match.

queryResetAccessToken.name: resetAccessToken
queryResetAccessToken.description: Set this query parameter to `true` to reset accessToken and authorityKey.

queryRecaptchaToken.name: hcaptchaResponse
queryRecaptchaToken.description: A hCaptcha token generated client-side by completion of a user-facing hCaptcha request.

queryStateKey.name: key
queryStateKey.description: A string identifier unique to an app for looking up state data.

400.description: An API level error occurred. This is often due to problematic data being provided by you.

401.description: An authorization error occured. This is often due to incorrect tokens or keys being provided, or accessing a resource that the provided tokens or keys do not have access to.

AnyValue.description: Can be anything. String, number, object, array, boolean, etc.

basicAuth.description: Basic authentication must be send in the format of usernameOrEmail:shaPassword, where usernameOrEmail can be the username or email associated with an account, andshaPassword is a sha256 hash of the users provided plaintext password.

get.description: Returns an array of apps owned by the authorized user, or public apps across HYPLAY if no authorization is provided.

200.description: Returns an array of apps owned by the authorized user or public apps across HYPLAY if no authorization is provided.

post.description: Create a new app for the authorized user.

iconImageAssetId.description: The assetId of the icon image. Icon images are recommended to be a 1:1 aspect ratio and at least 512x512 pixels.

backgroundImageAssetId.description: The assetId of the background image. Background images are recommended to be a 16:9 aspect ratio and at least 1920x1080 pixels.

logoImageAssetId.description: The assetId of the logo image. Logo image are used on pages like preregistration, questing, etc and can be any aspect ratio.

description.description: A brief description of the app and what it is and does.

url.description: The URL of the app, such as its website or where users can learn more about it.

discordUrl.description: The URL of the app's Discord server.

redirectUris.description: An array of valid redirect URIs for the user authorization flows of the app.

200.description: Successfully created a new app. Returns an app object.

get.description: Return a public app object for the provided appId.

200.description: Returns a public app object.

patch.description: Update an app owned by the authorized user for the provided appId.

iconImageAssetId.description: The assetId of the icon image.

backgroundImageAssetId.description: The assetId of the background image.

logoImageAssetId.description: The assetId of the logo image.

description.description: A brief description of the app and what it is and does.

url.description: The URL of the app, such as its website or where users can learn more about it.

discordUrl.description: The URL of the app's Discord server.

redirectUris.description: An array of valid redirect URIs for the user authorization flows of the app.

resetSecretKey.description: If true, reset the secretKey of the app.

resetTestSecretKey.description: If true, reset the testSecretKey of the app.

200.description: Returns the updated app object.

get.description: Get the public, protected, private state of an app, user or key.

200.description: Returns a state object that may contain public, protected, and/or private state for the app, key or user for the authorized user session.

publicState.description: Public state data for the app or user.

protectedState.description: Protected state data for the app or user.

privateState.description: Private state data for the app or user.

post.description: Set arbitrary JSON blobs for public, protected and/or private state specific to an application or authorized user of an application. This is useful for saving different types of data specific to users or global configuration of your app or game in many different situations. It is intended to be highly flexible. State set for a user of your app, a unique lookup key, and the app itself are all isolated to your application. State storage is not globablly shared between applications.

key.description: Any unique lookup key for this data. This can be things such as a hyplay user id, an internal battle match id for your game, some arbitrary settings identifier for a system of your app and more. Keys are flexible ways to create string based lookup identifiers for data you want to store/lookup. Keys are unique to your application and are not shared globally.

publicState.description: Public state data to set for the app or user.

protectedState.description: Protected state data to set for the app or user.

privateState.description: Private state data to set for the app or user.

overwrite.description: If true, the state will be overwritten with the provided state. If false or omitted, the state will be deep merged with the provided state.

200.description: Returns a state object that may contain public, protected, and/or private state for the app, or user of the app for the provided userId.

publicState.description: Public state data for the app or user.

protectedState.description: Protected state data for the app or user.

privateState.description: Private state data for the app or user.

get.description: Returns an array of public users objects representing users of the apps. A HYPLAY user is considered a user of the app if they have had at least 1 active session for the provided appId.

200.description: Returns an array of public user objects.

get.description: Returns a public user object representing a user of the app that also includes the `totalAppReferrals` property which represents the number of other users the user for the provided userId has referred to the provided appId.

200.description: Returns a public user object that includes a `totalAppReferrals` property.

get.description: Returns an array of assets that have been uploaded by the authorized user ordered by most recent creation.

200.description: Returns an array of asset objects.

post.description: Create an asset object by uploading a file in base64. Returns an asset object.

fileBase64.description: The base64 string of the asset being uploaded. Uploads may not exceed 5mb.

200.description: Returns a created asset object.

get.description: Return an asset object that has been uploaded by the authorized user for the provided assetId.

200.description: Returns an asset object.

get.description: Returned an array of contracts owned by the authorized user.

200.description: Returns an array of contracts owned by the authorized user.

post.description: Creates a new contract for the authorized user.

chain.description: The chain the contract is deployed on.

abi.description: JSON string of the contract's ABI.

metadata.description: A JSON string of metadata for the contract.

200.description: Successfully created a new contract. Returns a contract object.

get.description: Returns a contract object for the provided contractId.

200.description: Returns a contract object.

patch.description: Updates a contract owned by the authorized user for the provided contractId.

abi.description: JSON string of the contract's ABI.

name.description: The contract's name. Named contracts are easier for users to identify during app or game authorization flows through HYPLAY.

description.description: A description of the contract and what it does.

metadata.description: A JSON string of arbitrary metadata for the contract. May be used by developers for a variety of reasons.

200.description: Returns the updated contract object.

get.description:
Get the value from a read function of a target contract. This endpoint is designed to be highly flexible. It can read any contract by providing a contract address for `contractIdOrAddress`. It can also read using contracts created in the HYCHAIN systems through the `POST /v1/contracts` endpoint, which will utilize the contract's ABI.

Additionally, reads can be performed as a HYCHAIN app, user or user's session provided, through header authorization, or any arbitrary address or walletId provided through the `as` query parameter. Alternatively you can omit all of this and perform a read as no specific address.

The `func` query parameter accepts a complete function signature with parameters, such as `getCount()` or `readCounter(address,uint256)`, or a known function name without parameters if a contractId was provided for `contractIdOrAddress` and the contract's ABI is known. Such as `readCounter`.

200.description: Returns the result of the contract read as a string.

delete.description: Ends all active sessions for a given user. This endpoint is flexible and can end sessions in a number of ways. An app can end any user's sessions of their app directly, or a user can end their own sessions for an app, or a session access token can be used to end its associated session.

appId.description: If the `X-App-Authorization` or `X-Session-Authorization` header is not set, `appId` must be provided to indicate the application for which to end user sessions for.

userId.description: If the user's `X-Authorization` or `X-Session-Authorization` header is not set, `userId` must be provided to indicate the user for which to end sessions for.

chain.description: The chain to end sessions for.

204.description: Returns an empty response indicating the session has been ended.

post.description: Returns a session object with a valid access token when the associated exchangeCode and application authorized by using its secret key is provided.

exchangeCode.description: An unused exchange code associated with the provided session id. Exchange codes can only be used once and then become invalid.

200.description: Returns an updated session object with an `accessToken` set.

get.description: Returns an array of templates. Templates can be used to quickly deploy contracts to HYCHAIN and HYCHAIN_TESTNET. Templates can also be reviewed and approved by the HYPLAY team to be made available for anyone to deploy. Templates that are not approved can be deployed by anyone to HYCHAIN_TESTNET, and only deployed by the creator to HYCHAIN mainnet.

200.description: Returns an array of template objects.

post.description: Creates a new template. Templates can be used to quickly deploy pre-approved types of contracts to HYCHAIN and HYCHAIN_TESTNET.

solidity.description: The solidity source code of the template to compile. This must be a flattened contract with all imports inlined.

target.description: The contract from the inlined solidity source code that is intended to be deployed for this template.

200.description: Returns the created template object.

get.description: Returns a template object with abi, bytecode and compilation errors or warnings included.

200.description: Returns a template object.

get.description: Returns an array of transactions for the provided appId, sessionId, userId or walletId. Transactions are returned in descending order of creation date.

200.description: Returns an array of transaction objects.

post.description:
Create and submit a transaction to the target contract id or address. Transactions are submitted on behalf of the authorization type used, such as an app, user or user via a user's session.

Transaction submission supports contract function invocation and native transfers to contracts or externally owned accounts (EOAs).

This endpoint is designed to be highly flexible. Please refer to the HYCHAIN guides and documentation for detailed examples of the many ways this endpoint can be used.

func.description: The function name or function signature of the contract.

args.description: An array of arguments to pass to the function.

value.description: The amount of native token to send with the transaction.

deadline.description: The deadline for the transaction as a timestamp in seconds.

signatures.description: An array of signatures for the transaction.

chain.description: The chain the session is to be started for.

200.description: Returns a transaction object.

get.description: Returns a transaction object for the provided transactionId.

200.description: Returns a transaction object.

get.description: Returns a public user object when provided a username.

200.description: Returns a public user object.

get.description: Returns a public user object associated with the provided session access token.

200.description: Returns a public user object.

get.description: Returns a wallet object for the provided walletIdOrAddress. If walletIdOrAddress is a HYCHAIN system wallet id, it will return a matching wallet for the id. If walletIdOrAddress is a on chain smart contract wallet address, it will return a matching wallet from the HYCHAIN system. If a wallet is not found in HYCHAIN's systems for the address or walletId provided, a 400 error will be returned.

200.description: Returns a wallet object.

get.description: Returns the native token balance for the smart contract wallet associated with a wallet id provided for walletIdOrAddress. Or, if any address is provided for walletIdOrAddress, it will return the native token balance for the address.

200.description: Returns the native token balance for the wallet in readable string format. For example a 1e18 balance would be '1.0'.
